channel.title: Break the path, excite new thinking.
channel.description: Break the path, excite new thinking.

item.title: Goat Farm Economics
item.description:
Goat Farm Economics

One day in early July, in a circa 1910 building on South Broad Street, Elizabeth Jarrett and Kris Pilcher discovered a jar of human teeth. The three-story, 28,000-square-foot South Downtown building had until recently been the office of dentist Dr. Dennis Jaffe. Allegations of Medicaid fraud put an end to the enterprise.

item.title: Review: Whittington's "With the Grain" creates dialogues between raw material and their results
item.description:
Review: Whittington's "With the Grain" creates dialogues between raw material and their results

Martha Whittington's With the Grain: Works on Paper, at Sandler Hudson Gallery through March 5, is an exquisite homage to the many virtues of wood: a primal material from which come the human creations of paper, furniture, furniture veneer and lumber for construction, to name only a few end products from trees as transformed after being harvested from nature.

item.title: Here's everything you need to know about Ladyfest Atlanta
item.description:
Here's everything you need to know about Ladyfest Atlanta

In less than three months, Ladyfest Atlanta will once again take over a handful of venues throughout the city. From May 16 until May 21, the festival will feature the work of women and gender nonconforming artists of all disciplines from the greater Atlanta area.

item.title: Theaster Gates and the Art of Building Altars to the Everyday
item.description:
Theaster Gates and the Art of Building Altars to the Everyday

Theaster Gates warmed up to the podium, starting his talk in hushed tones and looking a tad weary, removing and reapplying his new glasses, wiping his face - a gesture he would repeat a few times throughout the evening.

item.title: Wherefore Art Thou ATL? A Year in Review | Immersive Atlanta
item.description:
Wherefore Art Thou ATL? A Year in Review | Immersive Atlanta

For the sake of argument, let's accept as fact that our music scene is like any other ecosystem you may have read about in high school biology. Formed by the interaction of interconnected elements within the community and the environment that surrounds them, this system seeks to strike a natural balance that will allow it to organically develop and prosper.

item.title: MURMUR | community resource for DIY + ephemeral media
item.description:
MURMUR | community resource for DIY + ephemeral media

Murmur is a unique community resource. Our programming offers accessible, invaluable insight into DIY culture. We are an organization that provides spaces, tools, and educational resources with the specific intention of facilitating each individual's involvement in DIY media.
